trans-unit.source: Database-wide properties are stored in the database and are simpler for deployment, while system-wide parameters might be easier for development.

seg-source.mrk: Database-wide properties are stored in the database and are simpler for deployment, while system-wide parameters might be easier for development.

target.mrk: Database-wide properties are stored in the database and are simpler for deployment, while system-wide parameters might be easier for development.

trans-unit.source: If you are setting any system-wide properties, see if they can be set as database-wide properties instead.

seg-source.mrk: If you are setting any system-wide properties, see if they can be set as database-wide properties instead.

target.mrk: If you are setting any system-wide properties, see if they can be set as database-wide properties instead.

trans-unit.source: Are any properties being set in the derby.properties file? Some properties can only be set on a system-wide basis. If so, deploy the entire system directory along with the properties file. Deploy only those databases that you wish to include. Setting properties programmatically can simplify this step- you will not have to worry about deploying the system directory/properties file.

seg-source.mrk: Are any properties being set in the derby.properties file? Some properties can only be set on a system-wide basis.
If so, deploy the entire system directory along with the properties file.
Deploy only those databases that you wish to include.
Setting properties programmatically can simplify this step- you will not have to worry about deploying the system directory/properties file.

target.mrk: Are any properties being set in the derby.properties file? Some properties can only be set on a system-wide basis.
If so, deploy the entire system directory along with the properties file.
Deploy only those databases that you wish to include.
Setting properties programmatically can simplify this step- you will not have to worry about deploying the system directory/properties file.

trans-unit.source: Extra steps are required for deploying an application and an embedded database on read-only media.

seg-source.mrk: Extra steps are required for deploying an application and an embedded database on read-only media.

target.mrk: Extra steps are required for deploying an application and an embedded database on read-only media.
